name: The General's Friend
description:
According to the article of Dr.Isagani Medina from the National Commision for Culture and the Arts, entitled "Aguinaldo para kay Aguinaldo".  Emilio Aguinaldo, the first President of the Republic of The Philippines, back in the day when he was still a General befriended a "Kapre".  

A "Kapre", in the Philippine folklore, is a big, tall, creature that smokes a cigar, and stays at the top of a big old tree.  The word "Kapre", or Cafre in Spanish comes from the Arabic word Kafir, which means non-believer.

According to Dr. Medina, this Kapre gave the General a magical rune or amulet, that will make him immune to bullets and help him win his war against the Spaniards.
